result.execSummary:
The defendant Latasha A Sanford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit given for 4 days time served if revoked.
Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined at upcoming court date of March 10, 2015 at 8:30am.
***3-10-2015, Court APPROVES stipulation and ordered restitution set at $1,698.00 payable to Blanch B - to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.***

Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
Complete an anger management counseling program.
Complete a parenting class program.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED until 1-20-2015 at 12:00pm. As to condition time, Court ordered release privileges for the Day Reporting Center.
Court administratively ordered release privileges for child care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latasha A Sanford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Good Time; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request for good time.
DENYING REQUEST FOR RELIEF signed and filed
Defendant's pro se request for an early release.

Defendant Latasha A Sanford in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties have reached an agreement.
Parties stipulate to a restitution amount of $1,698.00.
Court APPROVES stipulation and ordered restitution set at $1,698.00 payable to Blanch B. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Associated with Charge #1
Dosage Probation Approved.

Defendant Latasha A Sanford in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State; defense counsel; defendant's boyfriend, William C.; and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for 4 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 7 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Correction - STAYED until 01-20-2015 at 12:00 PM.  As to the condition time, Court ordered release privileges for the Day Reporting Center.  Court "administratively" ordered release privileges for child care.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Complete an anger management counseling program.
* Complete a parenting class program.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Restitution to be determined at an upcoming Restitution Hearing.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Case adjourned to 03-10-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

Filed:

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Court approved.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
including a VICTIM IMPACT STATEMENT as to victim, Reginald B. filed by ADA James Griffin on behalf of the State.

Defendant Latasha A Sanford in court.  Defense attorney, Mary Guimont, appeared TELEPHONICALLY.  Jacob D. Corr for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Sentencing Hearing today.
Judge Donald is attending a family member's funeral.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 11-07-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $375.00 to Dr. Collins for services on 07-03 & 07-07-14.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Donald, Br 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Latasha A Sanford in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Latasha A Sanford in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

OFF RECORD.

Defense request for an adjourned plea date is granted.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 34  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Report of Dr. Deborah Collins does not support an NGI plea.  Defense withdraw NGI plea.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 34.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-23-2014 at 08:30 am.
7/9/14 report of Dr Collins.  kmw
For Examination under 971.16.  kmw

Defendant Latasha A Sanford in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Joy Hammond for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised that further JPoint violations will result in bail modification.  Defense counsel entered a plea not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of the client. Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit on 6/10/14 at 1pm as to the special plea. Order For Examination under 971.16, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hope A

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Latasha A Sanford in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Latasha A Sanford in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
